text: The quaking aspen is a term for two different aspen species. *Populus tremuloides, a native tree in North America. *Popullus tremula, the European trembling aspen. All aspens spread by suckers (root sprouts). They may come to air up to 40 m from the parent tree, and form extensive clonal colonies.Rushforth K. 1999. Trees of Britain and Europe. Collins ISBN 0-00-220013-9 == References == Category:Trees Category:Malpighiales
title: Quaking aspen
